alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 12:50PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Coffee, western Geneva, Walton and western Holmes Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1249 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Laurel Hill to near Niceville. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Santa Rosa Beach, De Funiak Springs, Geneva, Samson, Eglin Air Force Base, Union, Liberty, Freeport, Paxton, Ponce De Leon, Kinston, Coffee Springs, Oakwood Hills, Cluster Springs, Villa Tasso, Blue Mountain Beach, Logan Field Municipal A/P, Rock Hill, Glendale and Pleasant Ridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Florida.
